title: Council Decision of 21 March 2011 appointing the members and alternate members of the Advisory Committee on Safety and Health at Work for Luxembourg and Malta
header:
24.3.2011 EN Official Journal of the European Union C 92/9
COUNCIL DECISION
of 21 March 2011
appointing the members and alternate members of the Advisory Committee on Safety and Health at Work for Luxembourg and Malta
2011/C 92/05
THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN UNION
recitals:
,
Having regard to the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union,
Having regard to Council Decision of 22 July 2003 setting up an Advisory Committee on Safety and Health at Work (1), and in particular Article 3 thereof,
Having regard to the list of candidates submitted to the Council by the governments of the Member States,
Whereas:
(1) By Decision of 16 February 2010 (2), the Council appointed the members and alternate members of the Advisory Committee on Safety and Health at Work for the period from 1 March 2010 until 28 February 2013, with the exception of certain members.
(2) The Governments of Luxembourg and Malta have submitted nominations for a number of posts to be filled,
main_body:
The following are hereby appointed members and alternate members of the Advisory Committee on Safety and Health at Work for the period ending on 28 February 2013:
I.   GOVERNMENT REPRESENTATIVES
Country Members Alternate members
Luxembourg Mr Paul WEBER Mr Robert HUBERTY
II.   TRADE UNION REPRESENTATIVES
Country Members Alternate members
Luxembourg Mr Marcel GOEREND Mr Raffaele PAOLETTI
Malta Mr Joe CARABOTT Mr Jesmond BONELLO
III.   EMPLOYERS' REPRESENTATIVES
Country Members Alternate members
Luxembourg Mr Pierre BLAISE Mr François ENGELS
Malta Mr John SCICLUNA Mr Joseph DELIA
The Council will appoint the members and alternate members not yet nominated at a later date.
This Decision shall enter into force on the date of its adoption.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 21 March 2011.
For the Council
The President
MARTONYI J.
(1)  OJ C 218, 13.9.2003, p. 1.
(2)  OJ L 45, 22.2.2010, p. 5.
